label: Description
value: Small pouch with a small part of the drawstring remaining. Made of four rectangular pieces with a pointed curve on the bottom edge. Two panels are patterned by a landscape with a castle and two figures and a dog. The other two panels depict a seated woman sewing being shot at by Cupid. Small red hearts fill the background. Patterns have multiple colors on a gold background.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: gilt wire, silk and silver-wrapped silk Technique: weft-faced plain weave with continuous and discontinuous wefts.

label: Credit line
value: Bequest of Richard Cranch Greenleaf in memory of his mother, Adeline Emma Greenleaf

label: Description
value: Small pouch with drawstring made of four rectangular pieces with pointed curves on the bottom edge. Each panel is identical and has two lions facing a monogram surmounted by a crown above a vase containing a tulip and a carnation.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: horsehair, silk and metal-wrapped silk-core yarn Technique: tapestry woven

label: Credit line
value: Bequest of Richard Cranch Greenleaf in memory of his mother, Adeline Emma Greenleaf

label: Description
value: Fragment of a woven textile patterned by a vertically symmetrical pattern of two different offset and dovetailed rows of flowering plants. This fragment isolates on plants. Multi colors on a silver background.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk, metallic thread Technique: plain weave with complementary wefts and inner warps; binding on the front is 1/3 twill; four dark green, salmon, and yellow wefts; the other colors are bound on the front in 1/3 twill and free floating on the back; the silver is continuous and the silks discontinuous

label: Dimensions
value: Warp x Weft: 13.5 x 9 cm (5 5/16 x 3 9/16 in.)

label: Credit line
value: Bequest of Richard Cranch Greenleaf in memory of his mother, Adeline Emma Greenleaf

label: Description
value: Long narrow fragment from the right side of a pattern which had a ship at sea and bold vegetation in bright colors and metallic thread.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk, metallic thread Technique: plain weave with a set of supplementary warps (orange) and discontinuous supplementary wefts (silks and metallics) bound on the front in 1/3 twill

label: Dimensions
value: Warp x Weft: 97 x 11.5 cm (38 3/16 x 4 1/2 in.)

label: Credit line
value: Bequest of Richard Cranch Greenleaf in memory of his mother, Adeline Emma Greenleaf

label: Description
value: Long, narrow fragment with a pattern of a shell-like urn containing fruit in metallic and multi-colored silks.

value: Medium: silk, metallic thread Technique: 5-harness satin patterned by weft floats and floats of discontinuous supplementary wefts bound on the front by a supplementary warp in 1/3 twill

label: Credit line
value: Bequest of Richard Cranch Greenleaf in memory of his mother, Adeline Emma Greenleaf

label: Description
value: Fragment with vertically symmetrical pattern of rows of a double-headed bird with outspread wings and holding arrows in its talons. Floral vines make an ogee pattern.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk Technique: 8-harness satin (red) patterned by weft floats (yellow), alternate shots of which are complementary (dark and light blue); floats were bound on the front in plain weave (now worn off)

label: Dimensions
value: Warp x Weft: 62 x 26.5 cm (24 7/16 x 10 7/16 in.)

label: Credit line
value: Bequest of Richard Cranch Greenleaf in memory of his mother, Adeline Emma Greenleaf

value: Narrow trimming band with a repeat of a heraldic shield surmounted by a crown in multi-color uncut pile on a white satin ground.

value: Medium: silk, cotton Technique: uncut loops of supplementary warps in an 8-harness satin foundation (velvet)

label: Dimensions
value: Warp x Weft: 85 x 6.5 cm (33 7/16 x 2 9/16 in.)

label: Credit line
value: Bequest of Richard Cranch Greenleaf in memory of his mother, Adeline Emma Greenleaf

label: Description
value: Two shaped fragments of a stamped deep red cut velvet. Rows of offset flowers enclosed in detached "S" and "Z" curves which form a diagonal square grid.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk Technique: cut loops of a supplementary warp in a plain weave-like foundation (velvet) with a stamped pattern

label: Description
value: Unmounted fan leaf.  Cream satin printed by engraved plate in blue. At center, a profile bust of Napoleon being crowned with laurel by Abundance and Victory. The medallion on the left contains Peace scattering flowers, and on the right, War hurling lightning. Surrounded by ornaments, garlands, and architectural details in the neoclassical style.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk Technique: printed by engraved plate on 7\1 satin weave

label: Credit line
value: Bequest of Richard Cranch Greenleaf in memory of his mother, Adeline Emma Greenleaf

label: Notes
value: Unmounted fan leaf. Cream satin printed by engraved plate in blue. At center, a profile bust of Napoleon being crowned with laurel by Abundance and Victory. The medallion on the left contains Peace scattering flowers, and on the right, War hurling lightning. Surrounded by ornaments, garlands, and architectural details in the neoclassical style.

label: Description
value: Small flat rectangular cushion of red velvet embroidered in flat gold, gold thread and sequins with silks and metal tassels at the corners. Pattern of a coronet at center supported by and flanked by stylized foliage. Narrow border of S-curves.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk, metal, linen Technique: embroidered

label: Credit line
value: Bequest of Richard Cranch Greenleaf in memory of his mother, Adeline Emma Greenleaf

label: Dimensions
value: H x W (with tassels): 10.2 × 12.7 cm (4 × 5 in.)

label: Credit line
value: Bequest of Richard Cranch Greenleaf in memory of his mother, Adeline Emma Greenleaf

label: Description
value: Pair of double-headed crowned eagles in needlework attached to white silk embroidered bands. Eagles, worked in the round, are of plaited gold thread. The wings, tails, and crowns are wire covered with looped silver wire. Colored silk tufts hang from beaks, claws, tails and wings. Silk bands embroidered with couched gold and glass jewels.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk, metallic thread, wire, glass Technique: embroidered

label: Credit line
value: Bequest of Richard Cranch Greenleaf in memory of his mother, Adeline Emma Greenleaf

label: Description
value: Pair of elaborate tassels in needlework, attached to narrow silk bands with cut velvet pattern. From main tassels of colored silk and metal threads hang many small figures, animals and birds. One figure in bright red, modern and made in Guatemala.

label: Credit line
value: Bequest of Richard Cranch Greenleaf in memory of his mother, Adeline Emma Greenleaf
Design for Embroidery, Corner of Gentleman's Waistcoat

label: Description
value: Design for the square corner of a waistcoat or gilet featuring pink, purple, and blue flowers. A lyre and quiver of arrows can be seen along the bottom left border. A grey pegasus with blue and yellow wings appears in the bottom left corner.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and gouache, watercolor on cream laid paper

label: Provenance
value: Tony Martel, Lyon, France; Francis Morris; Richard Cranch Greenleaf, New York, NY; 1962: acquired by Museum
Design for Embroidery, Gentleman's Waistcoat Pocket

label: Description
value: Rectangular corner of a waistcoat or gilet, showing the welt pocket. The welt includes black pseudo-Chinese characters on either side of two parrots in blue, yellow, orange and red with green palmettes in their beaks. Chinoiserie flowers in pink, purple, yellow, blue, red, orange, and brown surround the welt.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and gouache, pen and black ink on cream paper

label: Provenance
value: Tony Martel, Lyon, France; Francis Morris; Richard Cranch Greenleaf, New York, NY; 1962: acquired by Museum
In the Deluged Marsh - The Shepherd (Au marais inonde - Le berger)

label: Physical description
value: Etching in black ink on cream-colored paper
Design for Embroidery, Corner of Gentleman's Waistcoat

label: Description
value: A chariot drawn by a butterfly and driven by another is followed by a third butterfly at the back. The butterflies are depicted in various colors and are all in profile facing left. An unfinished geometrical repeat pattern in yellow is seen below. A  few numbers and letters in black ink are dispersed on the butterflies and the chariot. The design for the waistcoat or gilet is carried out in the manner of Charles-Germain de Saint-Aubin's "Les Papilloneries Humaines."

label: Physical description
value: Brush and gouache, pen and black ink on oiled translucent paper, joined at center

label: Provenance
value: Richard Cranch Greenleaf, New York, NY; 1962: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Bequest of Richard Cranch Greenleaf in memory of his mother, Adeline Emma Greenleaf

label: Description

value: Pen and ink, brush and gouache, gold paint on cloth-covered cardboard
